title: Introduction to Hypnotherapy for Breaking Unwanted Habits
body: In this introduction to the Hypnotherapy for Breaking Unwanted Habits audio meditations, instructor Sophie Fox shares some insights to help understand how guided meditation and hypnotherapy works and all the benefits it can bring.
teaser: In this introduction to the Hypnotherapy for Breaking Unwanted Habits audio meditations, instructor Sophie Fox shares some insights to help understand how guided meditation and hypnotherapy works and all the benefits it can bring.

title: Addiction
body:
This Addiction guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who have a minor addiction and who want to work on the issue themselves.  Please seek medical help if you are suffering from a serious addiction. 

Please make sure you have listened to our introduction video at the start of this series to help understand how guided meditation and hypnotherapy works and all the benefits it can bring.  An addiction is classified as a pattern of behavior that has a negative impact on your everyday life or those around you. The worse the addiction becomes, the more of an impact it will have on your daily life. In this session we will help you to view how your life may be different should your addiction continue and help you to no longer choose to continue on your addictive path - instead choose a more positive way of life.  We recommend that you listen to our session at least four times so you can really compound the positive messaging, override the old beliefs and help your mind create new neural pathways to manage and control your addiction.
teaser: This Addiction guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who have a minor addiction and who want to work on the issue themselves.  Please seek medical help if you are suffering from a serious addiction.

title: Anger Management
body:
This Anger Management guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who want to control their anger and respond in a more calm and rational way.

Please make sure you have listened to our introduction video at the start of this series to help understand how guided meditation and hypnotherapy works and all the benefits it can bring. Anger is a result of thinking that we have been unfairly treated or disrespected, or that others have broken or fallen short of your rules, standards or expectations, and you won’t stand for it. Thinking this way can lead you to feel angry, which stimulates the body’s adrenaline response which is your body’s way of helping you to cope with either fighting or running away (‘fight or flight’ response).	We respond by acting or feeling an urge to act, in sometimes a threatening or aggressive way.  In this session we will help you to gain control of your emotions by helping you control your initial instinctive anger responses.  We recommend that you listen to our session at least four times so you can really compound the positive messaging, override the old beliefs and help your mind create new neural pathways to controlling your anger.
teaser: This Anger Management guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who want to control their anger and respond in a more calm and rational way.

title: Nail Biting
body:
This Nail Biting guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who bite their nails. 

Please make sure you have listened to our introduction video at the start of this series to help understand how guided meditation and hypnotherapy works and all the benefits it can bring.  About 20 to 30 percent of the population are nail biters.  Nail biting is an oral compulsive habit and can be associated with anxiety as the act of chewing on nails reportedly relieves stress, tension or boredom. People who habitually bite their nails do so when they feel nervous, bored, lonely or even hungry or even just out of habit. In this session we will help you break the habit of biting your nails for good.  We recommend that you listen to our session at least four times so you can really compound the positive messaging, override the old beliefs and help your mind create new neural pathways to stop biting your nails.
teaser: This Nail Biting guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who bite their nails.

title: Obsessive Behaviors
body:
This Obsessive Behaviors guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who suffer from obsessive compulsive behavior.

Please make sure you have listened to our introduction video at the start of this series to help understand how guided meditation and hypnotherapy works and all the benefits it can bring.  Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) consists of two main parts: obsessions and compulsions.  Obsessions are unwelcome thoughts, urges, worries or doubts that repeatedly appear in your mind which can make you feel very anxious.  Compulsions are repetitive activities that you do to reduce the anxiety caused by the obsession. It could be something like repeatedly checking a door is locked, repeating a specific phrase in your head or repeatedly washing hands.  Your mind thinks it’s helping you to be less anxious by repeating rituals but ultimately it’s feeding the sensations. In this session we will use the rewind technique to teach your mind to disassociate from the learnt cognitive patterns that your brain has become accustomed to so you no longer feel the need to react in the same way. We recommend that you listen to our session at least four times so you can really compound the positive messaging, override the old beliefs and help your mind create new neural pathways to managing and controlling your OCD.
teaser: This Obsessive Behaviors guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who suffer from obsessive compulsive behavior.

title: Overcoming Laziness
body:
This Overcoming Laziness guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who lack motivation or suffer from bouts of laziness.

Please make sure you have listened to our introduction video at the start of this series to help understand how guided meditation and hypnotherapy works and all the benefits it can bring.  If you’re tired of being idle, doing nothing, resisting effort, procrastinating and postponing things and you no longer want to live in a state of passivity and of letting things stay as they are, then it’s time to make a change. By listening to this session you will feel more motivated and energised to overcome the tendency for laziness once and for all.  We recommend that you listen to our session at least four times so you can really compound the positive messaging, override the old beliefs and help your mind create new neural pathways to feeling more motivated and having more energy.
teaser: This Overcoming Laziness guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who lack motivation or suffer from bouts of laziness.

title: Social Media
body:
This Social Media and phone addiction guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who want to spend less time on their phone or looking at social media less.

Please make sure you have listened to our introduction video at the start of this series to help understand how guided meditation and hypnotherapy works and all the benefits it can bring. Social media & phone addiction is a behavioral addiction that is characterized as being overly concerned about being on your phone or social media, driven by an uncontrollable urge to be with your phone or log on to or use social media, and devoting so much time and effort to social media and your phone that it impairs other important life areas. We recommend that you listen to our session at least four times so you can really compound the positive messaging, override the old beliefs and help your mind create new neural pathways to being on your phone and social media less.
teaser: This Social Media and phone addiction guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who want to spend less time on their phone or looking at social media less.

title: Sugar Addiction
body:
This Sugar Addiction guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who want to take control of the amount of sugar they eat.   

Please make sure you have listened to our introduction video at the start of this series to help understand how guided meditation and hypnotherapy works and all the benefits it can bring.  If you have decided it’s time to take control of the amount of sugar you consume and you desire a healthier diet and all the benefits this brings, then this audio will help you say no to sugar and replace any cravings and urges for more healthier, nutritious alternatives. Resulting in a healthier mind and body and boosting your immune system.  We recommend that you listen to our session at least four times so you can really compound the positive messaging, override the old beliefs and help your mind create new neural pathways to cutting back on sugar.
teaser: This Sugar Addiction guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who want to take control of the amount of sugar they eat.

title: Teeth Grinding & Jaw Clenching
body:
This Teeth Grinding & Jaw Clenching guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who grind their teeth or clench their jaw.

Please make sure you have listened to our introduction video at the start of this series to help understand how guided meditation and hypnotherapy works and all the benefits it can bring. Teeth grinding and jaw clenching (also called bruxism) is often related to stress or anxiety. Some studies predict that teeth grinding could affect 8% to 31% of the general population.  In this session we will help you to relax and release any feelings of stress and anxiety to break the habit of clenching your jaw and grinding your teeth for good. We recommend that you listen to our session at least four times so you can really compound the positive messaging, override the old beliefs and help your mind create new neural pathways to stop grinding your teeth or clenching your jaw.
teaser: This Teeth Grinding & Jaw Clenching guided meditation & hypnotherapy session is aimed for people who grind their teeth or clench their jaw.
